page.title: 15SCHOOL ENVIRONMENT.
page.content: The houses around the school are mainly terraced and are between 80 and 100 years old.There are many places of worship, with temples in Kimberley Road and Craven Road,a mosque in Grosvenor Road,a gospel hall on the corner of Corbett Street and Chester stret,and an Elim Church in Cambridge Street as well as the parish chuch.These different types of places of worship cater for people from different backgrounds in our multi- cultural area. It is a convenient place to live,being near town and near the railway station Most people live here because of their jobs.My parents moved to Rugby from Hong Kong because my father used to work in a take-away in North Street. Many people hav extended their houses in the front and have modernised them, thus changng them over the years.
